column2: <string>.split(separator[  limit]) splits a string on separator  optionally only up to a limited number of substrings

Splits the given string by occurrences of the separator (itself a string) and returns a list (or array) of the substrings. If limit is given  after limit â€“ 1 separators have been read  the rest of the string is made into the last substring  regardless of whether it has any separators in it. The Scheme and Erlang implementations are similar but differ in several ways. JavaScript differs also in that it cuts  it does not put the rest of the string into the last element. See the example here. The Cobra implementation will default to whitespace. Opposite of join.
